title: How Elon Musk Damaged Twitter and Left It Worse Off
abstract: Mr. Musk swooped in and exposed Twitter’s lack of business and financial prospects. After criticizing the company’s weaknesses, he now wants to back out of buying it.
byline: By Kate Conger and Mike Isaac

multimedia.caption: The billionaire SpaceX owner and Tesla chief executive Elon Musk.
The billionaire SpaceX owner and Tesla chief executive Elon Musk.
The billionaire SpaceX owner and Tesla chief executive Elon Musk.

title: What Is Delaware’s Court of Chancery and Its Role in Elon Musk’s Twitter Deal?
abstract: If Twitter sues Mr. Musk to force a sale of the company, the case is likely to end up at a 230-year-old court in Delaware.

title: What’s Next in the Elon Musk-Twitter Saga? A Court Battle
abstract: Most legal experts say Twitter has the upper hand. But Musk revels in brinkmanship.
byline: By Lauren Hirsch and Kate Conger

multimedia.caption: Elon Musk has moved to end his deal to buy Twitter. But the company is determined to force the deal through.
Elon Musk has moved to end his deal to buy Twitter. But the company is determined to force the deal through.

title: The Fight Over Truth Also Has a Red State, Blue State Divide
abstract: Several states run by Democrats are pushing for stiffer rules on the spread of false information, while Republican-run states are pushing for fewer rules.
byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Cecilia Kang

title: Advanced E.V. Batteries Move From Labs to Mass Production
abstract: Makers of batteries that could charge in a few minutes are setting up assembly lines, bringing the technology a big step closer to auto showrooms.

multimedia.caption: A test of battery technology in QuantumScape’s clean room in San Jose, Calif. Adapting production techniques to a factory setting is the next challenge.

title: Restaurants Face an Extortion Threat: A Bad Rating on Google
abstract: Emails sent to dozens of restaurants, including those with Michelin stars, threaten a barrage of one-star reviews unless owners pay.

multimedia.caption: Kim Alter, the chef and owner at Nightbird in San Francisco, received threats from scammers.
Kim Alter, the chef and owner at Nightbird in San Francisco, received threats from scammers.
Kim Alter, the chef and owner at Nightbird in San Francisco, received threats from scammers.

title: Twitter’s stock falls further as doubts swirl over Elon Musk’s takeover.
abstract: Shares have lost a third of their value since April 25, when the company’s board accepted Mr. Musk’s offer.

title: What Are Spam Bots and Why They’re an Issue in Elon Musk’s Twitter Deal
abstract: Bots can tweet at people, share tweets, follow and be followed by other people. And there are good bots and bad.

multimedia.caption: Twitter says it removes about one million spam bot accounts each day.
Twitter says it removes about one million spam bot accounts each day.
Twitter says it removes about one million spam bot accounts each day.

title: Elon Musk Moves to End $44 Billion Deal to Buy Twitter
abstract: In a regulatory filing on Friday, Mr. Musk said Twitter was in “material breach” of the acquisition agreement.
byline: By Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch

multimedia.caption: A regulatory filing by lawyers for Elon Musk on Friday cited a disagreement over the number of spam accounts on Twitter.
A regulatory filing by lawyers for Elon Musk on Friday cited a disagreement over the number of spam accounts on Twitter.

title: Even in Death, Internet Explorer Lives On in South Korea
abstract: Why a country known for blazing broadband and innovative devices remains tethered to a browser that most of the world abandoned long ago.
byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Jin Yu Young

multimedia.caption: A tombstone in South Korea marks the final days of Internet Explorer. Microsoft shut down the web browser in June, but it is still needed for a small number of critical banking and government-related tasks in South Korea.
multimedia.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

title: Secret Service Director to Step Down and Join Maker of Snapchat
abstract: The director, James M. Murray, was appointed by President Donald J. Trump in 2019 and is departing after nearly three decades with the agency.

title: No. 2 Theranos Executive Found Guilty of 12 Counts of Fraud
abstract: The verdict for Ramesh Balwani, who helped lead the failed blood testing start-up, was more severe than the one for his ex-girlfriend Elizabeth Holmes.

multimedia.caption: Ramesh Balwani, the former chief operating officer of Theranos, leaving the federal courthouse in San Jose, Calif., on Thursday.
Ramesh Balwani, the former chief operating officer of Theranos, leaving the federal courthouse in San Jose, Calif., on Thursday.

title: Amazon Hub in Newark Is Canceled After Unions and Local Groups Object
abstract: The e-commerce giant planned to build an airport cargo center, hire 1,000 workers and invest hundreds of millions of dollars over 20 years.

title: Tech Is Not Representative Government
abstract: And yet, we demand that it protect us.

abstract: The drop was another fallout of rising inflation and widespread economic uncertainty, and a retreat after years of a funding boom.

title: Parents Sue TikTok, Saying Children Died After Viewing ‘Blackout Challenge’
abstract: The suit, involving girls ages 8 and 9, claims TikTok knew or should have known that its product was “addictive” and was directing children to dangerous content.
byline: By Michael Levenson and April Rubin

multimedia.caption: TikTok has said previously that the “blackout challenge” predated its platform and had never been a TikTok trend.
TikTok has said previously that the “blackout challenge” predated its platform and had never been a TikTok trend.

title: Steam Deck Review: A Game Console for the Quintessential Gamer
abstract: This new hand-held gaming device by Valve is lots of fun. But perhaps not as much if you’re a casual gamer.

title: The Latin of Software Code Is Thriving
abstract: Next time you laugh at musty old tech, remember that new technologies are often built on it.

title: Disinformation Has Become Another Untouchable Problem in Washington
abstract: Numerous federal agencies agree that widely promoted falsehoods threaten the nation’s security. Doing something about them is another matter.

title: ‘Ready to Rock, You Guys?’ The Winklevoss Twins Play Amagansett.
abstract: At the end of a tour that drew some social media mockery, the billionaire brothers’ rock band received a friendly reception at a venue close to their parents’ beach house.

title: The Jumbled Dream of U.S. Chips
abstract: It’s even harder now to understand what the U.S. wants to accomplish with its computer chip plans.

title: How Wall Street Escaped the Crypto Meltdown
abstract: As cryptocurrency prices plunged and funds failed, strict rules on risky assets helped Wall Street companies sidestep the worst. Retail investors weren’t as lucky.

title: On Conservative Radio, Misleading Message Is Clear: ‘Democrats Cheat’
abstract: Election fraud claims from 2020 are widespread on talk radio, contributing to the belief that the midterm results cannot be trusted.

title: No Guns, No Dragons: Her Video Games Capture Private Moments
abstract: Nina Freeman, a leading indie game designer, infuses her work with a poetic sensibility far from the tone of mainstream shoot-’em-ups.

title: Tesla Sales Slow as the Pandemic Hobbles Production
abstract: The decline in deliveries by the electric carmaker in the second quarter was the first drop since the beginning of 2020. The main culprit was factory shutdowns in China.

multimedia.caption: Teslas at a sales and service center in Vista, Calif. The rising price of gasoline has increased the appeal of battery-powered vehicles.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Prepares Meta Employees for a Tougher 2022
abstract: In an internal meeting this week, Mr. Zuckerberg said the tech giant was facing one of the “worst downturns that we’ve seen in recent history.”

title: Father of Technoblade, YouTube Minecraft Star, Says His Son Has Died
abstract: He read his son’s final message on the YouTube channel where the 20-something had entertained more than 11 million subscribers with Minecraft gameplay and wry commentary. The title: “so long nerds.”

title: TikTok tells Republican senators how it plans to keep American data away from China.
abstract: “We know we are among the most scrutinized platforms from a security standpoint,” the video app’s chief executive wrote.
